reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well located hotel a 5 minute walk from the Stazione. However the rooms are sparse, smaller than one might expect and included breakfast quite ordinary.The view from the room was non existent. Overall I do not think the room is worth anywhere near the price charged nor do I think this is a 4 star property even by European standards. However, to be fair, I have no point of comparison with similar properties in Monterosso. Compared with other 4 star properties in other parts of Italy that we visited recently, I would regard its 4 star rating with some scepticism.
reviews.title: Poor value

reviews.text: We wound up in this hotel because the room we reserved somehow got canceled, so this hotel was a fallback. It had a great breakfast, plenty of fruit and pastries - unfortunately that's the best thing I can say about this hotel. The rooms were dormitory style, the bathrooms tiny with a shower about the size of your high school gym locker. How on earth do they rate 4 stars?
reviews.title: No way should this be a 4 star rated hotel!

reviews.text: I would like to give this hotell 3 * + beacuse its breakfast dispite the fact that it wasnt properly cleand when i took the rom and there where problem with the sink. I payed 100 € for 1 person.
reviews.title: Not a 4 *

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here on our honeymoon in June, and did find it sort of difficult to locate. The staff was helpful and courteous, but we were surprised at how tiny the rooms are. Also the bathroom door would "lock" itself and it would take some serious effort to get out, kind of scary actually, we told the staff but it never got fixed. Other than that, the included breakfast, and the helpful staff and location were all pluses. If you don't mind a small room, and possibly a couple things needing repair, a pretty solid place overall.
reviews.title: Nice, but basic hotel right near the main strip

reviews.text: Live in Europe 3 months of the year, year had never visited the cinque terre. After much research landed on Monterosso and the Palme hotel. Watched Rick Steve's episode as apparently every second visitor. Things to know, the train literally arrives in the center of town upstairs from the center of the beach. This means you are no more than 5 minutes in either direction from either end of town. Pack light, forget the taxi and walk to your hotel. The Palme is at the end of town and slightly up the street. The Hotel exterior seems newly renovated as do the rooms we occupied. Not much of a view but Monterosso is not about being in the Hotel. Pleasant staff, adequate breakfast and a nice coutyard for an afternoon drink. No Internet in the room but available in the lobby.
reviews.title: What I wish Rick Steve's had told us

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Four of us, 2 couples, stayed here in Oct. 2011. Actually we checked out the day they were closing for the season. Ideally located, scrumptious breakfast & very friendly & helpful staff. Got to know Damien & Lina, night staff quite well & they were always very friendly & helpful with hints of where to eat etc.We really enjoyed our stay here & would recommend Hotel Palme to family &/or friends visiting this incredibly beautiful part of Italy. Bella Cinque Terre!!
reviews.title: Great stay, would recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose Hotel Palme because it had parking available and we felt was in a good location to access the other towns. We enjoyed the short walk to the train station and old town. We drove there from Tuscany, so the roads were a bit of a challenge, but once we got there we didn't need our car. We took the boat and/or train to the other towns and walked some of the trails. The hotel is a bit dated but very clean; and while our room was somewhat small, we did have a terrace which was great.
reviews.title: Good location with parking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent three days at Hotel Palme and would have enjoyed the hotel more if the staff had been friendlier. It wasn't until the morning we were leaving that the receptionist actually smiled and said she hoped our stay had been a good one. If only she had been as nice when we first arrived. Our room and the hotel itself were quite good and the breakfast was good however their rules put you off.
reviews.title: Liked the position

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel was well located if you arrive by train, like the beach, and like a quiet spot.
reviews.title: Well located, but lacked warmth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only a 5 min level walk from the train station along the waterfront, the hotel is situated a short distance up a side street near the end of the "new" town.
reviews.title: Great Staff at the Hotel Palme

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were two couples from Norway, staying on Hotel Palme July 3 to July 10 2010.
reviews.title: Beautiful location-nice staff-especially the night watch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A very pleasent stay. Nice small room, good breakfast, and located in the middle of everything in Monterosso. I was in doubt writing this review because I don't want all others to occupy the hotel. But now we have the reservations for summer 2011 in place, so then...
reviews.title: Nice place to stay in Monterosso!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our second week on vacation was at the Radisson Blue hotel in Nice. We emidiately longed back to the Hotel Palme. This summer we stay for 14 days.
reviews.title: Excellent location and perfectly spotless spacious comfortable rooms 4 * hotel with 3* prices

reviews.text: Quiet hotel in a great location. The bartender at night and the younger staff were very friendly! However, the older couple were not-we seemed to inconvenince them.
reviews.title: Good but not really 4 stars

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The main pickly point were the notices'warning' guests not to use the mini fridge to chill your own beverages as staff will remove them in the morning and not to remove any food from the breakfast room or you will be charged. Unacceptable and unneccessary.
reviews.title: A perfect place to stay
Free parking, but no private beach
reviews.text: Stayed for one night.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Clean, moderately sized room with a balcony with a partial sea-view.
reviews.title: Very comfortable clean hotel with friendly staff and great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Close enough to the train station and the docks, a bit of walk to the town.
reviews.title: Warm and friendly

reviews.text: Parking lot is a major plus if you're traveling by car.
reviews.title: Friendly family-run hotel in a quiet location

reviews.text: No private beach - wasn't a big deal for us, as we were only staying a night, and the beach is not much to speak of, but if it's important to you, keep that in mind.
reviews.title: Perfect location
